bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: James Weldon Johnson (1871-1932) was an African-American writer and a founder of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP) and its secretary from 1916 to 1930.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This photograph shows Johson sitting against a wooden post. It is signed on the bottom margin in blue ink: "James Weldon Johnson."
